prompt: Facts: An FIR was registered on 09.05.2013 at Police Station Civil Lines, District Moradabad, Uttar Pradesh, based on an application under Section 156(3) CrPC filed by Vikas Johar (brother of the appellant).; The complainant alleged that on 09.05.2013, the appellant (Vikram Johar) along with his parents (Gyan Johar and Pushpa Johar) came to his house, used abusive language, threatened to kill him and his family, and that the appellant fired shots from his pistol with the intention to kill.; Initially, the application under Section 156(3) CrPC was rejected by the Magistrate but allowed by the Additional Sessions Judge in revision, leading to the FIR registration.; After investigation, the police submitted a chargesheet only under Sections 504 and 506 of the IPC against the appellant and his parents.; Cognizance was taken by the Magistrate, and summons were issued under Sections 504, 506 IPC.; During the trial, after the examination of the complainant (Vikas Johar) as PW-1, an application under Section 319 CrPC was filed by the complainant.; The application sought to summon the appellant (Vikram Johar) to face trial for the offence punishable under Section 307 IPC (attempt to murder), based on the allegations in the FIR, the complainant's statement under Section 161 CrPC, and his deposition as PW-1.; The Trial Court allowed the application under Section 319 CrPC and summoned the appellant to face trial under Section 307 IPC.; The appellant challenged this summoning order before the High Court of Judicature at Allahabad.; The High Court dismissed the appellant's petition, upholding the Trial Court's order summoning him under Section 307 IPC.; The appellant filed the present appeal before the Supreme Court challenging the High Court's judgment and the summoning order. | IPC: Section 307 (Attempt to murder - Summoning under Sec 319 CrPC), Section 504 (Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace - Original charge), Section 506 (Punishment for criminal intimidation - Original charge)
